intro: Weinmannia paulliniifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive silvery coating due to dense pubescence. Weinmannia paulliniifolia produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
